New genetic data links raccoon dogs to the pandemic’s origin

A sample taken in a Wuhan market in early 2020 holds genetic traces of both the coronavirus and a small canid known as a raccoon dog, scientists report. The data boosts the theory that the pandemic started through natural spillover from animals rather than emerging from a laboratory.
